intro: Ochrosia kilneri, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom during the winter season. The plant has a dense, evergreen foliage with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil. Ochrosia kilneri prefers bright, indirect light and is relatively low maintenance, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
